footnotes.text:
2On August 9, 1839, the Board of Trustees, with Lincoln acting as president pro tem,
                  approved this petition.TheIllinois Incorporation Act of 1831, under which Springfield residents incorporated the town of Springfield on April
                  2, 1832, did not have a specific clause dedicated to petitioning for a special tax
                  upon owners of lots for grading or paving sidewalks and streets, but the charters
                  forLawrenceville,Carlinville, and other towns included specific sections to that effect.Springfield Board of Trustees Minutes, 9 August 1839, 25, Illinois State Archives,
